content: Triage reports for the week starting 30.11.2020. Monthly meeting will be held on 2020-12-02T17:00:00+01:00

S-waiting-on-author
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/78454 - assigned back to bugadani because it looks like this PR needs more work.
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76066 - assigned back to author pickfire to resolve merge conflict... jyn514 left a comment â€¢ "crlf0710 this needs a new reviewer, I think Lukas has left the libs team."
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/78181 - assigned back to author GuillaumeGomez because of build failure, not pinging
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/78928 - assigned back to author simonvandel for merge conflicts. but
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/77035 - assinged to mibac138 to fix merge conflicts
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76215 - estebank PR, could be closed maybe? "Aaron1011 commented on Sep 12 - Personally, I'd prefer if we limited this to cases where the previous output is potentially confusing, as I described in my comment. However, I don't feel very strongly about this, so I'll leave it up to you to decide."
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76130 - WIP PR, not doing anything
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76301 - matklad PR, merge conflict, not pinging
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/78177 - From another comment it looks like ecstatic-morse is no longer active - but was still assigned this PR to review, still assigned to author

S-waiting-on-review
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/78399 - looks like a test environment failure - oli-obk commented 17 days ago - cc rust-lang/clippy maybe we should revisit our test suite?
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79012 - waiting on review from estebank
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/77633 - still waiting on review but has sat idle for a month
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75414 - still waiting on review from eddyb, also idle for over a month
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/77530 - unsure what to do with this, maybe it should be closed because the work is going to be added elsewhere? pinged author MikailBag
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76808 - still waiting on review from matklad
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79015 - still waiting on review from KodrAus

S-waiting-on-review

#78399 21 days - unsure; seems like there was a weird bors CI failure that can't be easily fixed? - assignee: oli-obk
#79012 21 days - this is a perf-oriented PR IIUC but perf was negligible - assignee: estebank
#77801 18 days - seems like backported to beta but not merged to master? confusing :shrug: - seems like this fixes UB in std, so it's an important PR - assignee: withoutboats
#79084 17 days - reassigned from estebank to oli-obk since I think oli's a better reviewer for it

S-waiting-on-author

#76301 Sept 13 - all this needs is a rebase; pinged author (matklad) - assignee: jonas-schievink
#76723 Oct 26 - author needs to address review - author is a Rust team member (jonas-schievink), but it's been 6 weeks so I pinged - assignee: oli-obk
#78177 20 days - waiting on review; re-assigned to jyn514
#77307 Oct 28 - author (lcnr) needs to find time to work on it (as of Oct 28) - no ping - assignee: wesleywiser
#77377 17 days - DPC pinged author (ecstatic-morse) 17 days ago; no reply since - assignee: pnkfelix

Update for #77801: Mark-Simulacrum just posted this:

Going to go ahead and renominate for 1.49 backport (will do that this weekend). Would be great to make some progress here though.

Update for #79012: Author (Tyson Nottingham) just posted this:

Yeah, I don't have strong feelings on whether or not to push forward with this. I'll note that cycles, cpu-clock, and task-clock stats saw moderate improvements even though instruction counts saw very small improvements. But it's possible that was just luck with the variance.
fyi I think ecstatic-morse is taking a break from rust for a while

#78177 20 days - waiting on review; re-assigned to jyn514

taking a look at this now, this is a fun pr to review :) lots of code archeology
done, wow that was a lot of git magic :laughing:

re #77801: boats doesn't have much time to review things, but i'm not sure who else could review this. but yeah, bit of a weird situation that this is backported to both 1.48 and 1.49, but not approved for nightly.
@Mara do you think you could bring it up at a libs meeting perhaps? I could take a stab at it but I'm not sure how I feel overriding/interpreting boats' concerns on Pin usage

@simulacrum Yeah good idea, although boats said in an email this week they won't be joining any meetings until january.

It came up shortly during a meeting a while ago, while talking about general guidelines for PRs involving Pin. But we didn't go into this PR specifically much. boats just said they still needed to take a closer look at it.
you know -- I think we should just land it on master

Dec 4th, 2020, Friday.
S-waiting-on-review

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75522 ollie27
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79085 KodrAus
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72160 KodrAus
